name: Todd Addison
text: Did not correct my issue and was very stubborn about listening to what I was saying about it.  After his first surgery I still had same pain in my left hand. After the surgery, I was back to work within 3 days, typing on a keyboard all day. If I could give more than 5 stars, I would. I am currently scheduling my surgery with my other hand. Definitely check them out!

text: Dr. Bonatz has to be one of the worst doctors I’ve ever seen. My first visit with him was Nov 6 fracture ring finger sprained middle finger. He had me to start Occupational Therapy immediately. My return visit with Dec 8. My range of motion had improved however the strengthening had not even begun. All of my OT were saying the same thing my hand needed further OT because of my job. On Dec 8 2020 Dr. Bonazt entered the room and began talking with the door of the room wide open. I asked if he could close the door while we discussed my injury. His response no because of COVID-19 a violation of my patients rights mind you Dr. Bonazt was not wearing a mask nor gloves so much for concerns. Also, while waiting on him the door was closed the entire time and anyone else that entered closed the door behind them. He ask me what my job title was twice which I’m sure was on my report. He indicated that the fracture was healing pretty good I didn’t need surgery and therefore there was nothing else he could do. I question him because I must be 100% my strength in my hand indicated that I could hold up to13lbs briefly. I asked him for copies of the report he denied me of that also, stating that workman’s comp would have to request it. Forgetting when I visit him the first time he did.  His sarcastic remarks and tone was very belittling. To add insult to injury as he was walking out he says if you break anything else come see me. Unbelievable and Rude he obviously doesn’t care because there’s no repercussions behind his actions.

name: Robyn Lyons
text:
I work in the medical field and had the privilege of treating many of Dr Jones IV patients, post surgery and throughout their recovery. His staff was always attentive, called back regarding any concerns with the patient and his patients adored him. I also saw them recover well from their respective surgeries with fantastic outcomes.

When I found myself in need of an orthopedist, I called the one I felt I had seen the best results in, in other patients. Dr Jones IV has seen me and my daughter now for several different injuries (4 different body parts between the 2 of us). He takes his time, listens to the problem/concern, discusses treatment options and respects that we, the patients, know our bodies the best. He doesn’t just throw something quick at us (meds/braces/etc...) and run out the door.

So for those who have waited a while to see him and gotten frustrated... He would have spent the same time with you. Appointments are made to stagger the number of patients that come in at once- Some are early, some are late, some emergency injuries pop-up (but not enough to warrant an ER visit) and those patients are worked into the schedule in order to be seen as well. Doctors also take call and may be pulled out to treat a very emergent case.

I have waited to see him for nearly 3 hrs once. I have also been in, out and pulling out of the parking deck in less than an hour. It’s the nature of physicians and their occupation. Personally, I can’t sing the praises of Dr Jones IV (and his staff) enough.

I was ushered around with whispers behind my back like I was a delinquent. When I found out and refuted the claims, I was told their system was new and my info was on the older system. name: Jeannie Bubbett
text: A few days after having bone spurs removed from my knee by Dr. Mark Patterson I began physical therapy at Drayer. I started the day they opened their Alabaster office. As their very first patient I have watched Drayer fill with new equipment and patients in need of their expertise. The atmosphere at Drayer has a very friendly vibe, good humor and easy conversations; everyone truly cares about their patients!  Because of their care and guidance my knee is so much better, and now I have been released with a custom home exercise program to help me improve even more! From the very first greeting I received when I arrived on day one to the last goodbyes from all of the staff, it was an awesome journey back to good health.  I highly recommend Drayer Physical Therapy Institute!

name: K. Trimmer
text: Cannot say enough good things or recommend Drayer PT more strongly. My daughter was battling a serious quad sprain for months. She was evaluated by her therapists until all the dynamics of her injury were known and then a comprehensive therapeutic plan was specifically designed for her. Hours were spent making sure she knew how to do the exercises properly, why she was doing them, and how important it was to continue to do them after she was released from therapy. I feel very confident saying that the therapists were serious about my daughter’s care and dedicated to her recovery. Five weeks after her first day of therapy, she was healed and strong enough to begin conditioning for her ball team. It has been weeks and I am still getting calls from her therapist just checking up on my daughter. Still a pleasant surprise and very much appreciated.

text: Dr. Colbert needs to learn to listen to his patients. I saw him because of my right shoulder. He injected it, it lasted 1 week. Next appointment he wanted to inject again. I refused. He gave me prednisone by mouth and said he did not need to see me again. After I finished prednisone my pain was back.  I called and demanded to see a surgeon. So Dr. Colbert ordered an MRI. It showed a torn rotator cuff and biceps tendon. No I don’t ever want to see Dr. Colbert again!

resp.text: Thank you for your candid comment. We’re so sorry that this was the case. Your experience was not consistent with the type of care we aim to provide for our patients.

name: James Bishop
text: I’ve been dealing with a severe case of plantar fasciitis for over ten years. I had been to two different podiatrists, had shoe inserts, had multiple injections over the years. Dr. Colberg was recommended to me by another physician within the Andrews Sports Medicine family that I’ve known and trusted for years. He saw me and suggested the Topaz Microbrider procedure. They have a very high success rate and I had the procedure done. My healing was slow and my physical therapy hit a wall after about six weeks. I truly think Dr. Colberg was as disappointed as I was. He wanted to try the procedure one more time. He performed the second procedure in July. He suggested being patient with physical therapy. By November I was nearly pain free! I am now one year from the initial surgery. I have never been more impressed with a physicians intellectual and emotional investment in my case and care. It was a long and frustrating case and I wouldn’t be here without Dr Colberg and his team. I can not recommend him highly enough!

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words, and for taking the time to share your experience.

name: Barbara Mahan
text: I was first seen by Dr. Hunter Boyett, who scheduled me for an MRI on February 22, 2021.  The next day I called to get an appt. to get the results of my MRI appt. and was informed that Dr. Hunter Boyet would be out of the office till March 15th.  I was very upset by this because had I known I had to wait 3 weeks for an appt. and hopefully a path to relieving my pain, I would’ve gone somewhere else to another doctor.  I called and asked them if I could see another doctor in the interim and was told no, only Hunter Boyett could read me the results and prescribe anything I may need.  I will never go back there,  it made me feel like my needs were not important, and that waiting 3 weeks in a lot of pain was just the breaks.  I have had many good experiences with other orthopedic doctors in the area, this was a very bad experience and I do not recommend Athens TOC.  I am from another state and had this happened in my previous state they would not be in practice very long.  Professionals should act professional and treat their patients likewise.

resp.text: We are sorry to hear about your experience. Please call us at 256-233-2332.

name: Emily Hand
text:
The appointment was for me, Joseph Hand, not my wife.  Dr Laurence and his staff of PAs and RNs are prompt, professional, caring, friendly and very
patient.  I got a "steroid" shot in my shoulder and discussed further treatment options - they took the time to talk to me in detail.  WELL DONE!

name: Nikita Coleman Nance
text: This doctor is the absolute best. You can tell he care for his patients. I’m blessed to have him as a doctor.

name: S Terry
text: This was my first visit. They are very professional and Dr. Kyle was very informative and took the time to answer all my questions.

name: LInda Templeman
text: I was so impressed with the Orthopetic Center and especially Dr. Stanford. I'm older and he was patient with me and made sure l understood my diagnosis and treatment.

name: luis saavedra
text: The Doctor William Lawrence is a very good professional, he provides solutions,  as a person is very friendly. I recommend him

name: Maleah Eaves
text: I had a procedure done. I was supposed to get a call to schedule physical therapy and a follow up appointment. I have not got a call back and it has been around 2 months. And yes, I have tried calling. Every time I call I am on hold and then I get hung up on. I also had to go to the emergency room because I called the toc twice and had no answer. Definitely do not recommend!!

name: Eric Kelley
text: Dr. Stanford and staff are top notch, friendly and just all around awesome.

name: derrick gargis
text: We absolutely love Dr. Kyle. He's done two surgeries on my son, and we would recommend him to anybody.

name: Kala Bean
text:
Update: I was able to get an by the doctor. It was a much different experience at the Huntsville clinic than the Madison office.

Long wait, crowded waiting room during a pandemic at the Madison office. My appointment took 2 hours for a few x-rays and to be told I need an MRI after a 1 min exam. I got my MRI and rescheduled my follow-up and was not told that my follow up was at a different facility than the one I initially visited, resulting in me being marked as a no call no show. Also, my follow-up appointment was scheduled at 7:15 am, which was no problem, but when I called to try to figure out why I couldn't get into the building, no one answered at either facility I called. Very disappointing.

name: Blair Noel
text: Showed up 15 mins before my 945 appointment. I filled out kiosk sat down waited its now 1025 and the girl hands me more papers to fill out. They should have handed this to me while I had been sitting for 30 mins. I don't have extra time to be wasting I needed to go to work so I left. I just need my ankle to be checked out its over a month and still have not seen a doctor for it.

name: jessica holland
text: Toc is a very good clinic they care about their patients when i went their they got right on the problem whatever was wrong with my knee its the best bone and joint clinic and Dr.Lawrence is so nice i remcommned this clinic too anyone

name: LeeAnn Reed
text: This experience was great.  All these doctors are great people and professionals.

name: Stacey Dunn
text: Edited review. I still say the wait was too long for my first two appts (2-3 hours past appt time is a tad ridiculous).  I’m letting that slide though since Dr Boyett 100% fixed me!  I’ve been in pain for 3 years. He performed a laminotomy and discectomy. I woke up and the pain was immediately gone and hasn’t returned. I guess you wait longer when you are seeing a magician. I def would have gone a long time ago if I had known.

name: Anita Rice
text: My favorite doc!  Always smiling and so caring.

name: Linda Haggermaker
text: Dr. Lawrence and the staff at TOC in Athens are great! They are very helpful and care about their patients!

name: Deborah Sweeney
text: I am very happy with your building. I did not wait to long to get in to see the doctor.

name: Doug Nelson
text: Excellent doctor and excellent staff. Could not be more satisfied with the whole process. We were treated as nice and professional as any place we have ever been! We would highly recommend Dr. Stanford and the staff to anyone who needs their services!

name: Wendy Hollander
text: He took time to listen to my concerns.

name: Terrell Swindall
text: Got an appointment quickly.  Staff and doctor experience was great.  The only recommendation to make things better is to link the online registration profile information that is entered at home to the kiosk database.  For example, I had updated my insurance information online, but it was not reflected at the kiosk upon check-in.  Other than that, good job.

name: Dane Doerflinger
text: Very efficient, Great manners, very thorough

name: Hope Kirby
text: Dr. Stanford started helping me fix my knee about 6 or 7 months ago. He got me through a surgery and did an amazing job of it. Unfortunately my knee is in pretty bad shape and we are headed to a total knee replacement. He is doing everything he can to extend the time to keep me from having this surgery right now. He has the best bed side manner of any Dr I have ever used before and he really listens to everything I have to say. He is so sweet to me and gentle with my knee. I know a total knee replacement is in my near future but I know with him taking care of it I will make it through. He is an amazing dr. I won't use anyone else if i can help it. He walks me through everything every step of the way and he calms me before a surgery. It's a relief to know if I'm having a surgery that it's him behind the mask. He is everything a Dr should strive to be. We love Dr Stanford! He works miracles.

name: Lorinda Spencer
text: Dr Hatfield and Dr Stanford are excellent doctors and TOC Athens provides exceptional care. Their staff is friendly from the receptionist to the doctors. They are attentive and I would recommend them to everyone.

name: dawn calder
text: Dr. Hatfield and his staff are amazing. He expresses concern and listens to you. The staff are so professional and show such kindness. The first day I saw him and had a broken foot I was in tears because my son was getting married September 30. Dr. Hatfield reassured me he would take care of me and do all he could to help in the recovery phase. He also helped me to avoid surgery by continuing with a cast for 10 weeks. Yes, it was a long time being in the cast but I avoided surgery and will make it to my son's wedding. If I should ever need an orthopedic again I will return to him. Wonderful experience!

name: Dustin Bates
text: Highly recommended.  Knowledgeable, friendly, detailed, patient and fast.  Explained everything in great detail.  Same day cast.  In and out in about 1hr.  On time and efficient.  Very friendly staff.

name: Diana Isom
text:
They’re great. I had right knee surgery last year with Dr.Boyett and he was great!
Now next Thursday I got to have surgery on my left.
They’re very nice and professional people!

name: Paige Conway
text: I highly recommend Doctor Stanford. He did a great job with my ankle surgery. He is a kind person. He is professional but one can tell that he cares about his patients. He is never in a rush, as so many doctors often convey that they are hurried.  The Physical Therapy group that is rehabilitating patients is on the same floor as his office. They are also excellent.

name: Lynne Moseley
text:
Well managed practice - I was seen within 5 minute of my appointment times every time I was there.  All staff are very friendly and helpful.

I have had 2 surgical procedures (back and knee) with 2 different doctors and have absolutely had pleasant experiences both times.

This is a class act practice

name: Andy George
text: Great staff, doctors and facilities.

text: Love Dr. Lawrence and staff. From the time I checked  in until I left , I was treated with kindness and respect. Whatever the reason, I never felt that my issue was considered less of a problem than someone else. I highly recommend TOC for all of your orthopedic needs.

text: Today was my first visit. I was extremely  impressed with Dr. Lawrence and all of the our staff member. I would highly recommend this clinic my friends and family.

text: The doctor and staff showed empathy about my illness and this was the first time I have been made to feel this way out of all the doctors who treated me at other locations.  I was traumatized and the doctor and staff showed compassion and provided me with a wonderful platform towards rehabilitation.  I couldn't see the light at the end of the tunnel but with their guidance I have made progress and for that I want to say thank you and may God bless you all.

text: A nice, new facility. Plenty of parking. I was taken on time. Dr. Hatfield was kind and knowledgeable. He listened and asked if I had any questions.

text: The whole experience was unlike any other surgery I've ever had this staff is in a class above the rest I felt like there care was genuine and not just to make you just another number or just another surgery under there belt to get paid for they really care about getting me better and they listen to you instead of just telling you what they want you to do. Only problem I have with the staff is they really could have warned me that I might wake up with a catheter still in that was a experience I'll remember as long as i live LOL I will refer all my family and friends to TOC in Athens without hesitation. I really love my doctor he is really down to earth and doesn't seem to act like he is above you because he is a surgeon he has a real humbling attitude about him. He told me from day one not to worry that he got me I'm in good hands I truly believe that now. Keep up the great work guys

text: Doctor Hubleyis a wonderful doctor.  On time with my appointment.  X-rays were taken and treatment administered.  I recommend this place.

name: Debra Murphy
text: I had a total hip replacement 4 years ago by Dr. Hubley. I continued to have pain. The implant wasn’t seated right and had fibrous tissue between the bone and implant which is very painful. I ended up at Andrews Institute to attempt a revision, the first failed due to the lack of bone left, I am scheduled in October for another attempt. Four years of continued pain praying this doctor can correct this and relieve some of my pain.

name: Tina
text: Quick and gives you options. Dr. Huntley was generous to share info about cheaper options for me while considering my insurance coverage. His by Dre is great as well. I appreciate their quickness. Time is valuable.

name: Melinda Shaw
text: This was the first visit with Doctor Hubley.Due to Covid-19, we filled out our paperwork online and waited briefly in the car until we were called. Although I did not see any of the staff wearing masks, they did offer to provide a mask for my mother. Including exrays it only took around 30 minutes from start to finish as he said no treatment was necessary for her elbow bursitis. He answered all our questions and was very friendly. We appreciated how promptly we saw him and that we were able to get an appointment within a day.

resp.text: Thanks for taking time to share your experience, Melinda!  We work hard to get patients in quickly....and make visits as efficient as possible.  Thanks again for the positive feedback.

text:
Staff was friendly and caring. Was surprised that the X-ray tech questioned me about my ankle to determine what films to take before I saw the physician.
Not sure weather you reviewed my history before you came into the room. You wanted to prescribe me Celebrex and I had stated that I was allergic to it, causes ulcers in my mouth.
One of the issues I am experiencing is while walking in the boot and (I do have a sneaker on the other foot) it irritates my lower back and left leg.

text: Dr. Hubley is a fantastic Dr.  He and his staff are top notch.  And super fast.  I highly recommend him with gold stars.

I work in an orthopaedic hospital, so I know what a typical wait for this kind of thing is - not usually immediate!   Dr Hubley and his staff were kind, courteous and knowledgeable.  I highly recommend their clinic!

I went in yesterday miserable hip pain. After his treatment, I am 99% better today. He and his nurse Ellen are very empathetic and they go above and beyond for their patients. You can tell they went into medicine for the right reasons!!

Yep, they recognized the problem instantly and I finally received the treatment I needed. Dr. Hubley's incompetence caused me nearly two months of needless intolerable pain and loss of work.

name: Anne Sockwell
text:
I had a simply terrific medical experience at the Medical West Freestanding Emergency Department and the Hoover Health Center of the UAB Health System.  I fell on a flight of stairs and badly broke both the radius and the ulna of my forearm, below the wrist. The bones were badly out of place and I was very shocked and freaked out. We walked into the emergency room and it was a serene and quiet atmosphere. They told me I would be put into a room as quickly as possible and it happened very soon. People started tending to me immediately and I was given pain medicine. An x-ray machine was brought to the room so I was able to stay in bed while they did the films. As soon as they had the information from the x-rays, they gave me a “waking sleep” anesthesia while they moved the bones back into position (called reduction.). I felt nothing during the procedure, thank goodness.  When I woke back up, the pain was gone and my arm had been splinted so that the bones couldn’t move out of place. They put my arm in a sling and started asking me which doctor I would like to use for the surgery. We had no idea and started scrambling for information. We made some calls, and it was a week before anyone could even see us to evaluate.  The doctor who splinted my arm, Dr Herring, strongly suggested the orthopaedist in the building, Dr Stephen Gould. We looked Dr Gould up and he came from Johns Hopkins Hospital, so we thankfully said “Yes!”  Dr Herring had been sending all my films and information updates to Dr Gould from the  time I arrived. He was ready to see me that afternoon!  We simply walked down the hall from the room I had been in and I saw Dr Gould after a short wait. My surgery was scheduled in a few days and it happened at Medical West Hospital in Bessemer. There I had another Excellent experience from the UAB Health System!  The bones and incision have healed beautifully and I am sold - I am changing doctors so that I will be using this health system from now on. Thank you to Dr Herring and Dr Gould and staff who cared for me so well.
Anne Sockwell
Hoover, AL

text: In February of 2015 Dr. Goldstein did a total knee replacement on my right knee.  Based on my flexibility & recovery time, rehab folks kept commenting on how I 'really had gotten a good knee!' Knee replacement and rehab is not easy (I'm in my early 70's), but if Dr. Goldstein does the surgery and you do the rehab, you'll be good to go!

name: mixti cox
text: I saw Dr. Goldstein for a total knee replacement that became infected intra-op.  He sent me home despite the fact my wound was gushing fluid.  He refused to see me afterwards as the infection grew worse because my insurance had changed.  Orthopods in my home town refused to see me because they felt ethics demanded he stand by his own surgery. When I tried to politely discuss the matter with him he hung up on me.  When I posted a negative review at his workplace site, Saint Andrews Sports Medicine Clinic at Saint Vincent’s Hospital in Birmingham Alabama the owner posted a reply stating s/he was sorry I “felt” I had a negative experience there.  I feel pain every day and they have minimized my suffering. By the time nickle sized spots all over my leg were streaming pus I was nearly dead.  It took four surgeries plus an amputation to save my life, and I spent six months in the local hospital.  He ruined my life.  I was in the top ten% of my profession and can no longer find a job because I am confined to a  wheelchair, cannot stand and am unable to get my wheelchair in and out of the car without help.  I have no family and virtually no help.  He should have his medical license revoked.  It’s too late for me but please save yourselves from this incompetent.  Negative stars.

name: Bruce Tisdale
text:
Made my knee surgery as routine as it could be.
Dr Goldstein told me that there would come a time when I would have to think about it to remember which knee was operated on. He was right. I don’t think about my knee any more.
Thank you, Dr Goldstein

name: Mixti Cox
text: Dr. Samuel Goldstein caused my leg to be amputated after an intra-op infection during a total knee replacement.  When I was discharged the wound was gushing fluid but he sent me home anyway.  Then he refused to see me because my insurance had changed.  When I tried to politely discuss it with him he hung up on me.  No orthopedist in my hometown would see me because they felt ethics demanded that he stand by his own surgery.  He has never admitted wrongdoing.  By the time nickle sized pustules erupted all over my leg I was nearly dead from the infection.  After four surgeries it required an amputation to save my life.  I posted a negative review at Andrews Sports Nedicine Clinic where he works and the owner replied that s/hewas sorry I “felt” I had a negative experience there. I am now confined to a wheelchair, cannot stand and cannot find a job because I cannot get my wheelchair in and out of the car by myself.  I have no family and virtually no help.  Yes, I “feel” my negative experience every day of my life.  He only cares about profit, the patient be damned and should lose his license.  It’s too late for me, but spare yourself the agony of seeing this incompetent quack.

Once Jenny did an exam, Dr. Goldstein then came in.  I can honestly say he is one of the nicest people I have ever met!  He was so welcoming and I felt like he genuinely cared. As someone that is very familiar with orthopedic surgical procedures and doctors...he hands down is the best!  His bedside manor is a 10! The entire staff is amazing! The aftercare was great and recovery a breeze.  Dr. Goldstein is the only one I’ll go to for any and all my ortho needs! Thanks Dr. Goldstein!!

name: Dennis Gentle
text: One of the best at diagnosing possible causes of symptoms in one office visit and providing clear, understandable, logical explanations that I have ever encountered.  Outstanding professionalism, bed side manner and common courtesy.  After visiting another doctor for an evaluation of my sons back pain and being told “oh he’s just young and probably strained something. Give it a few weeks and if it doesn’t get better check back with us”, I immediately scheduled an appt for him with Dr Casey.  In one office visit, after doing a thorough evaluation, we were told what she suspected it to be.  A fractured vertebrae.  This was confirmed by subsequent contrast mri.  I have seen Dr Casey myself for a pain that turned out to be something orthopedics don’t treat.  However she had her team forward her evaluation on to my primary care and ordered the additional tests I would need for him to confirm the diagnosis.  So I had the results my primary care needed.  As a result it saved me a visit to my primary care and I received relief quicker as a result.  Which also saved me time off from work and another copay.  And she’s a Birmingham native working for the most prestigious orthopedic center in the area.  One of the best in her field.

name: April Adams
text: Dr. Casey is a very thorough doctor and was willing to get to the bottom of getting rid of my pain. She is smart and has a great bedside manner. And her staff is easy to work with.

name: Toya Williams
text: Only gave one star because it is the lowest I can give. I saw Dr Casey 6 weeks ago with a bad break on my thumb. It covered more than 50% of the joint surface (confirmed by second opinion with a hand specialist). She recommended a thumb cast and told me as long as I didn't mind a bump on my finger it would heal. She told me it was healing at 5 weeks even though the x-ray looked the same as the first. She told me to quit wearing the cast and start to use it. If it wasn't better in 2 weeks I would need to see a surgeon. Well I saw a surgeon today and it is too late to fix my thumb. He put a stack splint on to try and pull the bones together so fibrous tissue can form and help with my pain. I will never have full function of my thumb again, it won't bend all the way due to the break. And I will never be able to use my thumb without pain. It will also get arthritis because it was left untreated. Basically, the 5 weeks I spent under Dr Casey's care was a complete waste of my time. I hope no one else falls into this same situation.

Dr. Krauss did the procedure after setting up surgery (shunts to improve blood flow through my groin). I was a smoker up until that point. Dr. Krauss was a straight shooter throughout the whole thing. I was fortunate that I didn't loose that foot or even a leg. He emphasized no more smoking.  Sad that it took getting to this point to be ready.  In a nutshell, Dr. Krauss and Dr. Heideprem (vascular surgeon) saved my life and I will be forever grateful to them.

Highly recommend..

text: Dr Greco took time with me; I answered his questions. He answered my questions completely. He gave me the positives & negatives of surgery (arthroscopic).Surgery is my call.  His criteria if the cortisone shot into my shoulders helped then looking around in my shoulder arthroscopic & doing repairs is usually beneficial. I’ve had so many surgeries I know the system quite well. “I have more holes in me from surgeries than a screen door has holes”- RayWebb :-) The first stretch of weather so cold, I will call for arthroscopic surgery. I will golf until too cold, probably in January. Then another review will be forthcoming from me. I think positive The result would be in my favor because I would not do surgery with a low success rate. We will see. He is into sports injuries, so he understands my love for golf. He told me ,”Hit’em straight “- Dr. Greco. I do hit most of my drives straight, that’s is why my alias on golf course is “Da Middle Man”. The drawback a 200 yard drive is a monster for this 76yo.

text:
Dr Greco and his staff were first class in the care I received today in their office. I’ve been having shoulder pain that has been getting progressively worse for the last two month. When I called for an appointment, I was given one two days later.
Check in was very simple.
And I waited  about ten minutes from the time I checked in till I time a nurse got me to get xrays in his office. After the xrays I was seen by Dr Greco about ten minutes later. Dr Greco examined me and reviewed my xrays  with me and proceeded to explain quite clearly what my problem was. He outlined treatment options with me. This included injecting my shoulder that they did during this visit. I was a little nervous about the shoulder injection but before I knew it, they were done with minimal discomfort. I’m glad to say that shortly after the injection, the pain was gone in my shoulder. I’m scheduled for some follow up xrays and a return visit.
Dr Greco has made me feel so at ease about my problem and his approach to getting me through this. Although I have been putting off seeing someone about my shoulder pain, I’m so glad I saw Dr Greco today. I’d say on a scale of one to ten, Dr Greco is a fifteen. I look forward to my follow up visit. I would recommend Dr Greco and the entire staff at TOC without reservation.

name: June Lockhart
text: Dr Micheal Davis treated me and performed surgery on me. If you are considering using him for your spine, I recommend you find another doctor. Go to UAB or SOS. I was under his care for 22 months. During the time of my care, I told him I was in excruciating pain. I was treated as if I was narcotic searching. I went to 9 doctors trying to get my MRI repeated after Dr Davis refused to repeat the test. Once the MRI was repeated and found results of severe damage to my spine on all levels, I had no choice but to return to Dr Davis because of the “Doctors are God” big boy club of Montgomery. My surgery that was supposed to only be 2 hours long was an 8 hour surgery. My bones were splintered in my lower back. I had told him prior to the surgery that because of a medical issue that he needed to treat me as if I had a bone infection. He did not. Post surgery he lied and said, “ no more MRI’s, the rods placed in your back are real metal not titanium.” *** Real metal rods were pulled from the market in the year 2000. My rods were put in in 2012. Not only that but he wrote my surgical note rather than dictation and the numbers on my rods are not legible. I also had foot drop and had a massive infection post operative. This was not a tiny infection, my temp peaked at 105.1, plus blood loss. There is much more but I have said enough, find another doctor for your own safety.

name: Jeff Naile
text:
Six months out of surgery, four months of physical therapy and I still cannot raise my arm higher than shoulder level without severe pain. Post OP MRI shows, and I quote, " There appears to be a full thickness defect along the anterior supraspinatus at the level of the critical zone/footplate."
Hartzog decides NOT to do any repair and releases me with an impairment rating of 4%.
Yes, you read that right, 4%.
They are more concerned with their relationship with workers comp insurance carriers than the well being of their patients.
I have an appointment with another orthopedic surgeon for a second opinion.
Very disappointed with the level of professionalism at Alabama Orthopedic Specialists.

We finally saw Dr. Davis at 12:49PM. He came in and gave us his medical advice which was very unhelpful. I then asked if he would recommend another back doctor for a second opinion, and he refused to recommend anyone other than himself. As we were leaving, he proceeded to record his notes of our visit very loudly. The entire lobby could hear my fiancé's name, birth date, and all of the details of our visit. I will be reporting him for violating HIPAA Privacy laws, and we of course have cancelled all future appointments.

name: William Somar
text: Reputable surgery center but I felt like a number. Visited at the recommendation of my physical therapist for a shoulder issue. When I got to the lobby I could tell this place is set up for mass production: there were check-in kiosks like at the airport and a bunch of people waiting. When I was called the first time, it was to pay. When I was called the second time, I was led to a second  waiting room with no explanation. The third time I was led to an x-ray room where I found out I was getting x-rays. Surprise! Eventually, I was led to an examination room. No vitals were taken. I waited. Eventually, a doctor - not the one I had the appointment with - showed up and immediately started to discuss scheduling surgery without examination. He discussed two procedures - the second one was news to me. When I inquired, he then tested my range of motion to confirm what he had seen in the tests. I expressed doubts about the second procedure and he left to get the originally-scheduled doctor. After nearly 30 minutes, they both came back. The second (scheduled) doctor explained why he recommended the second procedure as a preemptive option. He did a good job of explaining the surgery and recovery. He left and the first doctor took me to a scheduler. Everyone I interacted with was cordial and professional. I never saw my x-rays nor the MRI I had brought with me. I realize this place is good and they have a lot of people to get to. I known they are all fine surgeons. But still, I felt like one more item to check off on their to-do list. I still have unanswered  questions and it is ironic that being there for 2.5 hours and waiting most of the time, that I felt rushed when it came to the consultation. In summary, one of the best places for surgery, but don't expect "the personal touch."

resp.text: Thank you for your candid response. We’re so sorry that this was the case. Your experience was not consistent with the type of care we aim to provide for our patients. Please feel free to call us at (205) 581-7128 if you would like to discuss.

This place runs like a well oiled machine. The staff is efficient and the Dr's listen to you and work to get you the best result.
I would definitely always use Andrew's Sports. Besides if you have shoulders as bad a s mine Dr. CAIN is the best by far.

name: Kenneth Byrd
text:
If I could give it a negative star, I would. My wife went to Dr. Henderson for 10 out of 10 pain in her right foot, unable to sleep due to pain and inability to walk on it. After a two hour wait, she was seen, by Dr. Henderson, which was weird because appointments were available all day?  She was condescending, said pain is being caused by a callous on the bottom of her foot and that a pumice stone would take care of it. Then my wife proceeded to take off her other shoe and stated " why isn't the callous hurting this foot." Dr. then said, well, maybe it is a bunion. No X-ray, no nothing.

Fast forward two days later, we are getting an X-ray and getting a second opinion. Come to find out it is a severe impact injury with bone growth (Spur) and needs surgery to remove. Dr. we obtained a second opinion from stated he makes his living off of people coming to him from Andrews with misdiagnosis or lack of adequate care.

resp.text: We’re so sorry that this was the case. Your experience was not consistent with the type of care we aim to provide for our patients.

name: John Pointon
text: I chose Andrews for total hip replacement a year ago after research online and personal recommendations from prior patients. I couldn't be more satisfied. Yes, they're busy - not surprising considering their reputation - but they are much more efficient than most medical practices struggling with all the usual issues: insurance; billing; scheduling; non-user friendly EMR systems; HIPAA; etc. etc. All aspects of the process - scheduling, pre-op briefing, surgery and post-op care were first rate. The surgeon took time to explain pros/cons and expectations clearly, and answer questions. Back on my feet in no time. Follow up during the year has been excellent and the procedure was transformative. Recently hiked extensive distances over rough, hilly terrain with no discomfort - fantastic!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your trust in our practice. In addition, thank you for your kind words and for taking the time to share your experience.

name: Tom Jenkyn
text:
As a disabled vet, I've had more than my fair share of orthopedic problems and surgeries. I had the good fortune to have Dr Steven R. Nichols perform multiple surgeries on my spine. Yes, they were different problems at different locations. He was recommended to me by friends in Sports Medicine at the University where I worked.

The first was a neck fusion, about 10 years ago. I was without pain, discharged, and went home the same day. Ten days after surgery I drove non-stop from Meridian, Mississippi to San Antonio, Texas. Last July he performed Lumbar Laminectomy surgery and removed the debris and spurs that were causing numbness in both legs and prohibited me from standing up straight. Again, discharged the same day, feeling returned to both legs and walking as the Good Lord intended.  There is not another Doctor on the planet I would allow to cut on my spine than Dr. Nichols.

His professionalism exemplifies what Andrews Sports Medicine stands for.  My family and I were always given  the same care and concern as the professional athletes they have become famous for treating. Simple logic dictates that if world class professional athletes with unlimited resources, who depend on their bodies performing at the level they do, seek out his services, it must be top notch. I have recommended him to friends and will continue to do so. If I didn't recommend him, it would be as though I didn't care about people who are an important part of my life.

text: Andrews Sports Medicine and Orthopaedics Center is a very busy place but it is run like a well oiled machine. I’ve never had to sit in the waiting room more than a few short minutes. Several friends recommended Dr. Sam Goldstein to me and I wasn’t disappointed.  Dr. Goldstein listened to me patiently, had my MRI done on the spot and gave me results that same day. My injury is still healing but I’m getting there.

I have been back at work a week standing in the middle of a busy highway directing traffic. He did an awesome job. Now if I could get people to slow down.

name: Brookelynne Mathews
text:
My husband had major foot /ankle surgery with Dr.Waldrop. He had all tendons repaired, his heel was moved over, the archilles tendon cut and lengthened!  It has been Over a year of being off work and unable to walk/stand or wear steel toe boots tk return to work . No matter how much we told this man that my husband IS in pain he did NOTHING except a few x-rays that NEVER show anything. It took an MRI and nerve test in the beginning BEFORE surgery to even find the problem. Not once did Dr. Waldrop order a MRI or nerve test!!  We had to insist on a referral to see a Pain management doctor because after two months he felt my husband didn't need pain meds.
The only thing  Dr. Waldrop would say is "Umm, I see". Never did any test after surgery except an X-ray, and we believe that's because he knows my husbands foot is worse after his surgery.
My husbands long term disability with his company has now been stopped due to Dr. Waldrops opinion that he can return to work WHEN HE CANNOT!!!
If you use this man make sure you get in writing from him BEFORE leaving his office if you can't return to work. !!

text: Ridiculously long wait time. There are several more doctors as good as these that won't make people wait so long

resp.text:
Cameron, we apologize for the long wait and inconvenience. We do our best to let all patients know to allow a minimum of two hours for their visit.

We are a high-volume practice. Our physicians are committed to spending adequate time with every patient to listen to their situation, properly diagnose their condition, discuss recommended forms of treatment, and address any additional questions and/or concerns they may have. Unfortunately, this sometimes results in long wait times.

text: Terrible waiting time. I waited 3 hours for my appointment, 3 people walked in and said Dr. Laubenthal said to send them back. This happened on 2 appt. Why the preferential treatment? Why make appointments if friends can walk right in? I moved to a great doctor that respects patients time.

name: Heather Miller
text:
I love Dr. Laubenthal because they don't just slap on a diagnosis. They really listen to what the patient has to say and they try to find the source. I like that they don't try to put on a band-aid rather than finding a solution to the underlying issue. I also love that Dr. Laubenthal takes parent's instinct into consideration when treating a child. I have been to pediatricians who literally said, "No that's not the issue." Dr. Laubenthal will say, "I don't think that is it, but you are the mom and God gave you instincts so let's look into it," or "This is why it can't be that" and gives me lab data or proof that I am incorrect in my thoughts.

I genuinely trust him to assess, diagnose, and treat my family and me. Here are a couple of other examples:

Dr. Laubenthal successfully diagnosed me with a condition when for years I was told I had something else and needed surgery. I now experience zero symptoms.

Lacey Quarles successfully diagnosed me with pulmonary emboli when it was thought I had pneumonia. I was hospitalized shortly after and told it was caught "just in time."

A few questions cancelled out numerous,  expensive,  unnecessary tests. I am very grateful to my regular Dr for referring me to this amazing place!

He asked me the same questions over and over. This is honesty. He asked me my age 3 times and how I broke my tailbone 3 times and what dr ordered my coccyx MRI when all I had already told him 2-4 times there was no MRI of the coccyx only an x-ray.  So he needs to get a little more memory because if not the medical field isn't for him.

But with all that being said Dr. MELLEMPATI IS THE BEST AND I WILL REFER EVERYONE TO HIM. I LOVE THE BEDSIDE MANOR AND THOROUGHNESS. HE NEEDS TO TEACH CLASSES TO THE OTHER DOCTORS. HAHA THANKS FOR A GREAT EXPERIENCE

text: Until today my review of Dr. Craig was quite positive. I was then told that Dr. Craig had a strict 15 minute no-show rule. This resulted in having to reschedule my appointment after I had driven 20 miles to get here and now I have to return in the morning. I have waited much longer than 15 minutes after my appointment time on occasion and yes I was very irritated when I was told there was no grace available.

text:
I refer to Dr. Craig as a medical detective. I had seen several physicians that could not figure out what was wrong with me. He discovered that I have a very rare neurological disorder. Without his knowledge and expertise, I could have suffered years with this with no help from the medical community.

My first couple of visits, I wasn’t sure how I felt about him. But I grew to really appreciate not only the physician, but the type of man he is. He tried his best to help me with a nerve block. That did not work for me. He could have done a series of them. But he did not. He knew that wasn’t what was best for me. He is not trying to line his wallet. Dr. Craig recommended another option that he doesn’t perform, nor does Southlake. Despite having to refer me, he is still looped in on the process and making sure I get the care I need. My case is proof, he is going to find what is wrong and do what is best for his patients.

We moved from Ga to Huntsville. During the move I started having severe lower back pain going down my leg also. I couldn’t sit or lie down without making it worse. My primary doctor order a MRI and then sent me to see Dr Larry Parker. He immediately saw the injury to my lower spine and asked would I like to fix it. Two days later I had my surgery and I got instant relief. I had a few bad days with pain but it was worth it.   Two months later I’m a hundred percent better. Dr Parker, PA Michael Jordan and staff are amazing. Highly recommend them. It is amazing to be feeling normal again. Thanks a million. It’s never to late to get healed because I’m 70 years old and suffered for years.
Love y’all and Thanks again
Sylvia Pirtle

text:

I expect to be able to return to riding my horses, hiking and everything I was previously able to do.  This was the 2nd back surgery I had (unrelated) and both were successful.  I would use Dr. Parker and his team in the future if needed, but hopefully I will not et hurt again.

text: I had lower back surgery December 5th with Dr Parker, I'm not trying to trash Dr parkers name but my back is 2× worse then it was when I went in. He keeps sending in his water boy "PA" who seems to only care about medication i was on leading up to the surgery and told me the pain is due to my brains opiate reseptors are some how affecting my pain tolerance.... I can barely walk right now and its been 8 months. I lost my insurance because I can't go back to work. I'm in a desperate situation and today I was told because I didn't have $150 to pay them to be seen, they wouldn't see me. There are a few things that threw up red flags when first talking to the Dr and high in sight I should of never allowed them to do surgery on me! My quality of life has deminished and I can't even hold my 2 year old son. It seems that Dr parker isn't a stand up person and had no reguard for his patients. I'm going to speak with a lawyer because a Dr who won't even attempt to help out his patient who has been affected by a surgery he preformed should not be practicing medicine!!. I plan on taking this to the medical board, ethics committee or any news outlet that will listen. DO NOT ALLOW DR PARKER TO PREFORM SURGERY ON YOU IF THERE IS A CHANCE IT MAY AFFECT YOUR LIFE FINANCIALLY  IN THE FUTURE BECAUSE DR PARKER ONLY WANTS YOUR MONEY!!  my name is Ryan Hunter and if you have any questions about this review feel free to contact me and i will  further explain this. Always seek a second opinion, I didn't and now I'm paying dearly for it! I'm also reporting him to the BBB and will sit outside his office to let people know just what's gonna happen if times get tough and you need the Dr to fix what he has messed up!! Thanks for nothing Dr Parker! You have completely screwed me over and I promise on everything I love you haven't heard the last of me! On a good note, the young lady at the front right desk in the lobby was very sweet and carring and if not for her I'm sure the police would be escorting me to jail for flipping out on his staff!! Sorry if this message offends some people, if you were in my situation I'm sure you would understand. Ty

name: brett davis
text:
In short ..well not so short but detailed and worth the read if you have chronic pain !..I had a on job accident 22 years ago in 1997..Dr.larry Parker fixed me up good ! Spinal fusion L4S1 back then. A Dr.Walker fixed a crushed wrist ...these guys after idk a year got me fixed up. In 2007 while ironworking  I did more damage..I bit the bullet from '07 til 2013-14 when my my right leg started going out ..i hadn't had insurance in years ..i went on disability, i lined the Dr. Visits and MRIs & xrays together for Dr.Parker to view before I drove 3 hours to see him . I had moved... As long as this man Dr. Larry Parker is breathing..hell be the only orthopedic that ever cuts on me or does anything he can do to me or friends if i can help it ! IN 4-13-2019 was the day for my surgery (i had developed spinal stenosis) I went in & under ) around 12 PM.  I awoke 3:30 with meds and assistant yes but I was up and walking!pain free .well pain from surgery expected ...but  almost pain free and my legs & neurological nerve endings in my legs was gone .after 12 years of chronic pain..3 with neurological in legs(bad enough it interfered with life )..within hours of being  there .. He fixed me again ! Speed up .Monday hardware installed in the back spine for support during the fusion time. So less than 12 hours of hardware installation ..I was signing paperwork to go Home this wasnt nothing new and I knew the drill..Michael Jordan did superb job as well as well as my Sunday Nurse ..you know who you are ..thank you ❤. I'm about 9-10 weeks out and I'm thinking the hardware is going to have to come out ...I'm feeling irritation to those muscles  but at least I'm pretty sure that's this problem.but you need to learn where the pain is coming from ..often after the need for the hardware is no longer needed..some folks it doesn't bother ..some I bet dont know it can be removed...(think of where and how your irritation is...you gotta help the Dr. ..talk to him ..he needs to know what you know ) chronic pain ?Take Notes !.some like me know..and while I realize its definitely needed!! But has it time ..I still have some aches and some pain on some days ..I'm a broken up 48 year old ironworker...I'm lucky to be alive thanks to God and Dr.larry Parker ! Hands down if your looking for a second opinion..look no more !this is coming from a man that's abused his body for about 30 years honestly! He has a good team always ! Mr. Michael Jordan does a good job..hes got a good teacher ..him and Parker are a little different but he wouldn't  be there if he wasn't...Parker wouldn't allow it ...His office Staff..has always been good ! Mrs.Mina .Great lady ! And another and I'm sorry I forgot your name ....Look nobody paid me to say any of this !this Dr. And his team 1. 22 years ago got me walking  and gave my life Back !at 27..at 48 they did it again! Honest to God if your searching for a spinal/orthopedic..look no more . Dr.Larry Parker is a Life changer folks and I wholeheartedly mean this ! This last time I was at the end of my ropes ..but 10 weeks later ..I'm smiling again ..yes I have some pain but hey..I was messed up . Dr. Larry Parker & Staff ! Thank you for everything  and i love and pray for you All ! P.S if you want good results ...DO WHAT THEY TELL YOU TO ..BLT...you'll know
..bending, lifting, toting...dont have it done if your not in a position to do as directed.. i promise it works !i stayed on a level 11-12 on a scale of 1-10 pain level...yep i still gotta take it easy..but stay active when your suppose to !..afterward..dont lay around ..be as active as possible..you spine needs it ..your body needs it. Do right for at least 10 weeks ! The other ..if you do feel an irritation...most likely its gonna be that hardware..6 months medically it can come out ..most insurance legally want 1 year.(Chexk that info ..things change)I'm about to call and leave him a note ..folks i cant Express enough how much this man has changed my life 2..twice ..i wont abuse it again! I'm for ever grateful! ✌ Peace, Love & Hope ! Brett Davis  7-1-2019 ! Still healing .

name: Chrissy McCandless
text: I can't say enough about this place. The staff are wonderful and extremely caring and knowledgeable. The facility is very clean and open, it does not feel as though you are "packed in" and overly crowded like most places. I have been to a few other therapy centers over the fast few years, and they are by far the best. I chose this location because I heard about a treatment called, dry needling. I have 2 herniated discs in my cervical spine and I have tried everything to relieve the pain from massage therapy to multiple steroid injections, a nerve ablation and even CBD oil with no relief. I am currently scheduled for my 2nd cervical fusion surgery in a few days, and prior to dry needling and this round of physical therapy, the pain in my neck and shoulder was at an 8 out of ten on the pain scale. I chose dry needling because as anyone with cervical spine issues knows, the knots in your upper back and shoulders are ridiculously painful. Today is my last day of physical therapy, in just 9 sessions of therapy and 4 dry needling sessions with Haley, my pain level went from an 8 to a 2, which is amazing. I would highly recommend Dreyer Physical Therapy to anyone seeking relief from pain. They are miracle workers.

resp.text: Thank you Chrissy!

text: The staff from front desk, to Dr. Dave, to All assistants, and tech's are a AWESOME team! My healing process is better everyday with Drayer @ Prattville!

text: They were real nice and helpful and worked with you in the pain

name: Ivey Lynn
text: Just on the first day, they were kind and very helpful. They become like your family who support you no matter what.

name: brandy harris
text: Great staff! Very helpful and caring!

name: Kylan Pettway
text: Great experience very friendly people

name: Galen Mathis
text: Great place!

name: S. Hitson
text: Rude, pushy, lacks compassion and RUDE!

name: Darrell Adams
text: Very professional team.  Dr. Stubbs took the time to answer all of my questions.  He is very thorough.  I would highly recommend him.

name: Christina W
text: Dr. Stubbs has a great bed-side manner and listened to my concerns and answered all my questions. We were concerned about my progress but he allowed me to be the tortoise that I am and gradually regain mobility as opposed to pushing me too hard. Dr. Stubbs is very empathetic and genuinely concerned with his patients' recovery! Would recommend him no questions asked IF you need surgery (hopefully you won't)!

name: Tonia Christan
text: The office is very clean and the staff are very nice. Dr Stubbs is amazing he was very caring with my 7 year old and took time to go over everything and cared what my son had to say and ask. He showed us xrays and explained it to us. He really is down to earth and very caring. His nurse is amazing to she was very patient and very compassionate with him. Love them both.

name: Nina Martin
text: Everyone was very professional. The woman that took the X-rays, the Dr’s assistant and the Dr were all great. They listened and were very nice. I’m so glad the service selected Dr Stubbs to be my Dr.

name: Debrah Masters
text: Dr. Stubbs is great. He's kind, compassionate and he actually listens to what I say. He has definitely improved my life situation and I am extremely greatful.

name: erica hatfield
text: Awesome experience, really listened to my issues! Would highly recommend 👌

name: Colleen Whittaker
text: After breaking my wrist while visiting the area for the winter,  appreciate all of the time Dr Stubbs has taken explaining all aspects of the surgery.  I feel Dr Stubbs truly cares.  I wouldn't hesitate to recommend him!

name: Amy Pippin
text: Really awesome experience! I came in with serious worries and he eased my mind with a exercise and stretching regiment, meds and a plan for less pain!!

name: XxFmjx33
text:
Dr. Stubbs is very professional and knowledgeable in his field. My 7 year old broke his wrist and although the break was a hard one Stubbs reconstructed it without having to go in with a major surgery. His wrist is now 100% 3 months later. Highly recommend everyone at his clinic, nurses and receptionist were always friendly and I never felt rushed.
Thank you Dr.Stubbs and staff

resp.text: Lisa - thank you for letting us know about your son's recovery. A wrist injury is always overwhelming especially with a young one anxious to return to sports and life in general.    We'll pass along the kind words to our team !

name: Tammy Richardson
text: I am a patient of Dr Stubbs and am.He is very professional and also caring.He takes the time to explain my condition with my knee and all my options and the risk with each one. I am also pleased with the wait time from the time I walk in the door till I see Dr Stubbs. My wait time in the waiting room after signing in has been around 10 minutes and then normally wait about 5 to 10 minutes in the room before Dr Stubbs comes in to see me. I so so very pleased and comfortable with Dr Stubbs and the staff at Bayside orthopaedic in Fairhope AL.

resp.text: we appreciate that thoughtful feedback Tammy - our entire team shares a commitment to not only the best care...but efficient as well.

name: Matthew Warden
text: Great doctor highly recommended I'd use him again if I have to, very bright we're blessed to have him in Foley. Thank you Doctor Stubbs

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words Matthew! We appreciate our Foley patients  - and look forward to seeing more of South Baldwin in our Gulf Shores clinic as well.

name: Cheryl McMann
text: I really like Dr. Stubbs, he was very compassionate and thorough.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words Cheryl!

name: Mary pitts
text: AWESOME DR. And staff!!! Always friendly, knowledgeable, and listens!!!!!

name: Andra Thomas
text: Great Doctor!! Highly recommend!!!

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words Andra - glad you're on the mend!
